content: 179 m c2 142 yds 130 m c3 149 yds 137 m c4 276 yds 252 m c5 180 yds 165 m c6 207 yds 189 m c7 184 yds 168 m c8 182 yds 166 m c9 226 yds 207 m c10 230 yds 210 m c11 326 yds 298 m and c12 314 yds 287 m these yardages only include the amounts used in the clues themselves extra yardage used as colorwork will be specified in the respective clue notes * **very important ** you will need to keep the leftover partial skeins as you will need some of them later in the pattern * arcoiris is a design that consists of four pieces that come together to create a beautiful shawl with a unique shape first you will work two rectangular panels that differ in every section but will match in size and dimensions next you will create a center square that ties together the three parts you will finish the shawl off with a sophisticated edging which is worked over four of the six edges each clue is unique and differs in texture construction and stitch pattern the project is designed to use a new stitch pattern in every clue to make it challenging but also fun * clues 1-10 are interchangeable if the instructions of a clue are too challenging you can substitute it with a previous clue at any time * yarn ends in clues 1 - 10 will not all be on the same side don t be alarmed if you re weaving them in on opposite ends * please make sure to carefully read every clue s specific note before starting each clue * because i am a tight crocheter i highly recommend checking your gauge against mine to ensure that you have enough yarn to complete the design and reach the desired measurements * gauge is crucial to this project since some clues use almost all of the yardage given in a skein please make sure to be on gauge to not run out of yarn * each clue s notes include unblocked and blocked clue measurements as well as gauge details these are mainly for you to keep track of gauge while working on your clues and to avoid running out of yarn please adjust your crochet hook size up or down if you significantly deviate from the specified numbers the gauge of each clue is given in repeats x row measure 1 pattern repeat and divide 4 by this number this will give you the number of repeats in 4 * you will block both panels and the center square together after clue 11 be advised that clues 1 - 5 and 6 - 10 need to have the same final dimensions including the edges of clue 11 so that everything fits seamlessly together * the pattern uses 12 colors but can be made with more or fewer if preferred * stacked single crochets stsc count as a stitch
